identificationModule.briefTitle: Ethnic Microaggressions and Smoking Behaviors Among Latinx Adults
identificationModule.officialTitle: Latinx Smokers: Evaluating Ethnic Microaggressions on Smoking Behavior and Relapse

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to examine whether microaggressions relate to multimodal facets of smoking behavior, subjective withdrawal, and urge/craving. Additionally, the second aim is to examine whether smoking deprivation moderates the relation between microaggressions and multiple facets of smoking behavior, subjective withdrawal, and urge/craving.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This proposal will employ a novel multi-modal approach to evaluate the role of microaggressions in relation to smoking lapse and topography among a sample of Latinx smokers. Adult Latinx daily smokers will attend two counterbalanced experimental sessions - (1) smoking deprivation (16 hours of smoking abstinence) and (2) smoking as usual - during which microaggressions during the relapse analog task will be assessed.

armGroups.label: Smoking Deprivation
armGroups.description: 16 hours of smoking abstinence prior to experimental visit.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Microaggression Recall and Relapse Analogue Task

armGroups.label: Smoking as Usual
armGroups.description: Smoking as usual prior to experimental visit.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Microaggression Recall and Relapse Analogue Task

interventions.name: Microaggression Recall and Relapse Analogue Task
interventions.description: Participants will engage in a microaggression recall task followed by the McKee Experimental Relapse Analogue Task

primaryOutcomes.description: Smoking behaviors will be operationally defined as smoking topography (e.g., puff behavior) measured via the Clinical Research Support System (CReSS; Plowshare Technologies, Borgwaldt KC, Inc., Virginia).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During the Smoking as Usual Visit and Smoking Deprivation Visit (Visits are randomly ordered, counterbalanced separated by ~14 days)

primaryOutcomes.description: The 8-item Minnesota Withdrawal Scale will be used to assesses withdrawal severity. Each of the items are rated on a Likert-type scale ranging from 0 to 4. Items are summed to produce a total score with higher scores indicative of worse outcomes (possible range 0-32).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During the Smoking as Usual Visit and Smoking Deprivation Visit (Visits are randomly ordered, counterbalanced separated by ~14 days)

primaryOutcomes.description: Smoking urge/craving will be measured with the 10-item Questionnaire of Smoking Urges-Brief (QSU-B). Each of the items are rated on a Likert-type scale ranging from 1 to 7. Items are summed to create two subscale scores and a total score with higher scores indicative of worse outcomes (possible range 7-70).
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During the Smoking as Usual Visit and Smoking Deprivation Visit (Visits are randomly ordered, counterbalanced separated by ~14 days)

primaryOutcomes.description: Smoking Lapse Behaviors will be measured during the Relapse Analogue Task (RAT), during which participants are able to delay smoking for a small financial reward. For this task, Smoking Lapse Behaviors are conceptualized as two variables: (a) minutes in time of smoking delay (possible range -50 to +50) and (b) number of cigarettes smoked
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During the Smoking as Usual Visit and Smoking Deprivation Visit (Visits are randomly ordered, counterbalanced separated by ~14 days)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Being 18 years of age or older
* Current regular (daily) cigarette smoking for \>= 1 year
* Current smoking \>= 5 cig/day and biochemically confirmed via carbon monoxide (CO) analysis
* Being self-identified as Hispanic or Latino
* Able to provide written, informed consent
* Endorsement of at least one microaggression experience over the past 6-months

Exclusion Criteria:

* Endorsement of current psychotic symptoms
* Active suicidality
* Currently pregnant

locations.facility: RESTORE Laboratory: Research on Emotion, Substance Treatment Outcomes, and Racial Equity
